text:
Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Creamy head. Dark brown purple ruby body.
Nose and flavour reminds me a bit of a Barley Wine.
Aromas of barleys, malts, prunes, prunes, toffee, sweet liquor...
Flavours of prunes, raisin, bitters, malts, toast, dried leaves, bit herbal, light dry, some grass towards the aftertaste and something light sweet...
Aftertaste is bitter, grassy, prunes, malts and a bit dry...
Low carbo, close to silky mouthfeel, good bbalanced medium bodied.
Wow, this is very nice! Well done Gulpener! Looking forward to your other crafty beers!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
33cl bottle from Gall & Gall Delft.
medium beige head. Murky dark amber pour. Pretty good for the abv.

Bottled. 33cl sample. The aroma has caramel malts, hint of spice. Clear, brown coloured beer with a medium, off-white head. The taste is light-moderate sweet, has caramel and spice. Full bodied, bit boozy.

0.33l bottle. Hazy amber body with a beige head. Aroma of caramel, orange zest, apricot, nutmeg and some floral hops. Taste of bread, apricot, raisins, dark sugar, orange zest and floral hops. Great beer.
hazy amber colour, medium sized creamy yellowish-beige-ish head; aroma of burnt sugar or caramel and dried apricot,; taste is basically the same with honey notes; great eisbock!

Bottle from Gulpen. Hazy brown-copper. Very sweet dessert wine aroma. A bit boozy, banana, sweet wine and apple. Definitely a night cap kind of beer. A big one to end a huge tasting. Thanks Kapusil and Lore for a badass tasting.

(Gulpener IJsbock) Bottle 300ml from the local Coop supermarket. Served into a tulip, ABV 10.3%
Dark brown coloured body, murky, with a big and thick beige head on top.
Aroma has dark fruits, berries, banana, belgian yeast.
Taste has wheat, dark fruits, caramel, banana, some spices, a hint of alcohol.
Medium thick body.
Not very complex but quite drinkable and tasty, and for just 1.80, yes please.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a clear amber to red with a small greyish or yellowish white head and an aroma of roasted and sweet malts, whole grain bread, toffee, red grapes, prunes, figs, dates, raisins, banana, wheat, spices, grass, floral hops and booze. The taste is heavy sweet with a full body, creamy mouthfeel and a warm boozyness and slight bitterness in the finish. Pretty good!

Bottle from Mitra Bunnik, BB March 2018, 30 cl sample. Slight hazy amber color, big frothy head. Aroma of a regular autumn bock with toast, caramel and slight autumn spices, but then a bit pumped up and stronger. Quite a lot of toast and caramelly sweetness, slight alcohol and spices. A dunkler bock on steroids.

30 cl. botle @ home, bought @ Coop Culemborg
Hazy light brown with a beige head. Malty aroma with some port/red wine notes. Taste is medium bitter and the body is fairly thick. A very tasty winterwarmer with a surprisingly smooth finish considering its ABV. very well done.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2017 30cl fles. Troebel bruin kleur, middelfijne romige licht bruine schuimkraag. Aroma van kruiden en karamel. Smaak is zoet, kruidnagel, zoethout en karamel. Vol lichaam, veel koolzuur.

0,7 l Bottle share. Appearance: A light hazy red color, with a very small off white head. Aroma: malts, caramel, plums, dried fruits, raisins, touch of liquorice, nuts, and a hint of clove. Taste: moderate sweet following the aroma, with some alcohol in the finish.
Average body, average carbonation. 

Solid brew.

Brown coulered beer with beige head. Aroma Like Bock but more intens. Taste is intens and is like aged beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JAN 25, 2017 Medium mokka coloured head, dark brown coloured head, fruity malts banana like smell, medium co2 medium bitter banana malts some coffee like taste

Bottle 75cl. Poured into a lager glass. Sweet malt nose; cloudy medium amber, good frothy beige head, fairly lasting, good lacing; aromaroasted malts, caramel, brown sugar, licorice, yeast; smooth taste, light heavy sweet and light bitter, roasted malts, toffee, light banana, spicy notes; sweetbitter aftertaste, fruity and spicy notes, warming alcohol (but well-hidden); full-bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation; pleasant and solid bock, not super rich but very drinkable.

Bruin/Amber, crèmekleurige schuimkraag, troebel, iets koolzuur. 
Aroma: Geroosterde zoete mout, donker brood, karamel, rood fruit, pruimen en rozijnen en een lichte banaan hint.
Smaak: Zoete donkere tarwemouten, karamel, kruidig en licht verwarmend van de alcohol, gedroogd fruit, gist/banaan, floraal bitter....grassige hops.
Volle body , kruidig en prikkelig mondgevoel....nog vrij romig al is dit een lager, afdronk is bitterzoet en warm.
Degelijk bouwwerk!

Brown, lasting head. Rustic brown malt, typical lager palate, clean caramel. Strong, good taste, but not like German eisbock, more like a well aged normal one. I dont mind, its good. Not too boozy either. Could even use more. (75cl bottle gift from Sjoerd, thanks! Shared with Darren)

Drinking blind from a 75cl bottle. 
In the aroma alcohol, wood, malt,Porto, raisins and prumes. 
The clear brown beer has a medium brown head. 
In the taste chocolate. 
High carbonated.

750ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut!
Extra thanks Mart - this brings me to 10 of every style, and youve been about a third of the hardest to find ones - thanks again! Rich sweet bananaey aroma, but some banana string harshness too. Toffee rich in the taste, and some more banana. Not saying 10.3% in taste and feel, but there is a heat in the gullet a few seconds after swallowing. Finish is back to banana strings. Ingredients on bottle said gerstenmalz, but this has to be heavily wheat, Id put money on it. Rather decent, Ill take a top-up thank you... and another...

Bottle (from het biermoment). Pours brown with beige head. Aroma is sweet, sugary, booze, malt, dryness, slight potatoes, wheat. Flavor is sweet and bitter, malt, some dark fruits, raisins, caramel, slight potatoes, spiciness. Feels surprisingly smooth. Drinkability is good for abv. Overall: very good, gets better as i drink it.

750ml bottle (thanks Mart). Slightly hazy dark amber color. Medium size, white head, stays. Sweet, malty, faint banana, yeasty in aroma. Sweet, yeasty, shy hops, banana in taste. Shy hops in aftertaste is really nice. Nice full body. Alcohol is hidden. Very drinkable and solid brew.

Tap: Amber coloured, small but lacy off white head; sweet nose of dried fruits, toasted malt, dark malt and hidden herbal hops; moderate sweet flavour, low bitterness, full bodied and soft; lingering sweet fruity and dark-malty finish with a light bitterness. A fine brew

Tap @ Proeflokaal Arendsnest, Amsterdam. Aroma of malt, boozy and deep caramel. Hazy brown colour with lasting white head. Taste is boozy, alcohol sweetness, moderate+ sweet and light+ bitter. Full body, oily smooth feel and malty sweet finish.
Tap at In de Wildeman. Hazy amber with beige head. Marzipan, lots of wheat, sweet grapes, light red wine, dough, raisins. Over medium sweet and under medium bitter. Almost full bodied. Decent.

Draft at In De Wildeman. Cloudy brown with a medium cream head. Aroma of malt, caramel, overripe dark fruit, toffee and malt. Flavour is above moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Medium bodied with alcohol coming out in the palate and light carbonation.
75cl fles thuis, schenkt bruin/rood met beige kraag. aroma van caramel en zoete mout en alcohol. Smaken van caramel, mout, veel alcohol, plakkerig zoet, bruine suiker, graan, maar ben er niet weg van
Grote fles van de Mitra. Donkerbruin met rode gloed, kleine lichtbruine kraag. Vooral behoorlijk alcoholisch. Verder caramel en wat kruidigs. Een tegenvaller.

Bottle @ home shared by Joeren86. A bit hazy red color, virtually no head. Smell and taste malts, dark malts, raisins, plums, caramel, lightly sweet. A bit thin bodied, some alcohol coming through, average to medium carbonation. Ok beer.

Bottle. Color: Hazy dark brown, small off white to beige head. Taste: Pretty sweet, lightly roasted malts, hints of raisins, liquorice, cloves, red fruit / plum and caramel. Medium to full body, soft to average carbonation. Bit warming alcoholic mouthfeel and finish. Quite nice beer.

Draught at Amersfoorts Bockbier Festival 16. Hazy dark brown with a small off-white head. Medium to full body with moderate carbonation. Sweet and bitter tones. Malts, caramel, herbs, spices and brown sugar. Quite OK.

Tap at Amersfoorts Bockbier Festival, 2016: Slightly hazy dark brown colored brew with pretty sweet taste and some burning in the mouth. Hints of dries fruits, liquirice and caramel. Gulpener is well busy in the brewing of different beer styles, no other commercial brewery can or will do so in the Netherlands.
Draft @ Moortgat. Murky dark ruby, tanned lacing foam head. Sweet aroma, raisin. Sweet in taste, warm alcohol feeling. Raisin notes again. (Arnhem 201609)

30cl van de tap bij Nieuw Bruin, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 10,3%
Uitgeschonken in origineel Gulpener glas

Uiterlijk: hazelnootkleurig met kleine schuimkraag

Aroma en smaak: gebrande mouten, caramel, zoet, bittertje

Conclusie: prima bock, nog eentje besteld daarna

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home. Aroma is wheaty malt, caramel, plum, dried fruits, raisins, touch of liquorice, nuts, and a hint of clove. Flavour is sweet and a bit sticky, not too boozy at all, alcohol is surprisingly well-hidden. Body is above medium. Bit like a WeizenEisBock. Nice one.
Corked bottle. Dark brown color, malt, caramel and raisin in the aroma. Wheaty sweet caramelly, raisinny flavor. Just a hint of warming alcohol. Licorice. Not bad.

from draft at poshoorn maastricht, poured a murky dark brown colour with a creamy light tanned head. nose of caramel, grains, dried fruits, plums, alcohol heat, toffee and light cloves. taste is quite alcoholic hot, sticky, caramel sweet aftertaste.
